intro: Bupleurum gerardi var. trichopodioides, commonly known as the slender false angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine or subalpine zones. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
